javadoc:
OperandRepresentation provides a list for operand sub-elements. The number of elements are expected to remain constant for a given code unit operand regardless of its format.
The list may contain various Objects including any combination of Character, String, VariableOffset, Register, Address, Scalar, LabelString, and nesting of other OperandRepresentationList objects.
All objects returned must support the toString() method for producing an appropriate listing representation.

methods.name: setPrimaryReferenceHidden
methods.comment:
Set flag indicating that representation does not include primary
 reference representation.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the primary reference is not reflected in the representation.
methods.name: isPrimaryReferenceHidden
methods.comment: Returns true if the primary reference is not reflected in the representation.

methods.javadoc:
Set flag indicating that representation encountered an error.
@param hasError
methods.name: setHasError
methods.comment: Set flag indicating that representation encountered an error.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the representation encountered an error.
 Error will be reflected within the representation as a String.
methods.name: hasError
methods.comment:
Returns true if the representation encountered an error.
 Error will be reflected within the representation as a String.

methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Returns a formatted string representation of the specified code unit operand.

name: OperandRepresentationList
comment:
OperandRepresentation provides a list for operand sub-elements.
 The number of elements are expected to remain constant for a given code unit
 operand regardless of its format.
 
 The list may contain various Objects including any combination of Character,
 String, VariableOffset, Register, Address, Scalar, LabelString, and 
 nesting of other OperandRepresentationList objects.
  
 All objects returned must support the toString() method for producing
 an appropriate listing representation.
